wikipedia_page.main: George Abraham Gibbs, 1st Baron Wraxall,  (6 July 1873 – 28 October 1931) was a British Conservative politician.

link_mentions.page: List of political families in the United Kingdom
response: *********George Gibbs, 1st Baron Wraxall MP for Bristol West 1906–1928, Government Whip 1917–21. Son-in-law of Walter, 1st Viscount Long.

The Barons Wraxall are members of another branch of the Gibbs family; their seat was at Tyntesfield. George Henry Gibbs, father of the first Baron Aldenham, was the elder brother of William Gibbs, grandfather of George Gibbs, 1st Baron Wraxall.
* George Gibbs, 1st Baron Wraxall (1873–1931)James Miller, Fertile Fortune: The Story of Tyntesfield, 2006; p. 142

Gibbs succeeded his father, George Gibbs, 1st Baron Wraxall, in the barony on 28 October 1931 at the age of three. His mother was the Honourable Ursula Mary Lawley, and his godmother was Queen Mary of Teck.Fertile Fortune: The Story of Tyntesfield By James Miller. National Trust Books, 2006
He was the second son of George Gibbs, 1st Baron Wraxall, by his second wife, the Hon. Ursula Mary Lawley. He was educated at Eton College and Christ Church, Oxford.
* George Gibbs, 1st Baron Wraxall (1873–1931), British member of parliament and peer
* George Gibbs, 1st Baron Wraxall, British Conservative politician
